Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient feels overwhelmed and is struggling with the stress of divorce and job searching.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient expresses feelings of being stuck due to fear of failure and uncertainty about job skills. They also feel guilty about the divorce and are concerned about how to communicate this to their children.
Therapeutic Interventions: The therapist suggests role-playing the conversation with the children to prepare the patient for discussing the divorce.
Next Steps: The patient plans to research local event planning companies and set aside time to do so.
